title: Legend starts to overlap with the plot when multiple cohorts were selected.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behaviour

body:
### Issue Description

The issue is found when setting multiple cohorts when calling `Explanation.cohorts(N)`, the legend starts to be overlapped with the plot. The actual code related to the issue can be found [here](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/c24ff9ac72a2a21fc83f5097ffccf50f5429875d/shap/plots/_bar.py#L278). 

A possible solution would be to placed on the top left, see the suggestion below: 
`pl.legend(fontsize=12, bbox_to_anchor=(0, 1.02, 1, 0.2))`

### Minimal Reproducible Example

```python
import xgboost
import shap

# train XGBoost model
X,y = shap.datasets.adult()
model = xgboost.XGBClassifier().fit(X, y)

# compute SHAP values
explainer = shap.Explainer(model, X)
shap_values = explainer(X)

shap.plots.bar(shap_values.cohorts(4).abs.mean(0))
```


### Expected Behavior

The legend should be placed outside of the plot so that the plot is visible to users.
